quizzes.question: Which big white castle is over 370 years old?
quizzes.funFact: Did you know? This castle is so important that the whole world helps protect it!

quizzes.question: Where does Ghana's president work and make big decisions?
quizzes.funFact: Fun fact! This building is also called Jubilee House and it looks super fancy!

quizzes.question: Where did Ghana celebrate becoming a free country in 1957?
quizzes.funFact: Wow! Ghana was the first country in sub-Saharan Africa to become independent!

quizzes.question: Which park has a bridge almost as tall as a 10-story building?
quizzes.funFact: Amazing! You can walk high in the treetops on a rope bridge called a canopy walkway!

quizzes.question: Who was Ghana's very first president?
quizzes.funFact: Did you know? Dr. Nkrumah helped many other African countries gain freedom too!

quizzes.question: Where does the president of Nigeria live and work?
quizzes.funFact: The villa sits at the base of a huge rock formation called Aso Rock in Abuja!

quizzes.question: Which famous Lagos building is shaped like a military hat?
quizzes.funFact: The National Theatre hosts plays, music, and dance — it was built in 1976!

quizzes.question: Which square in Lagos is named after a powerful woman trader?
quizzes.funFact: Madam Tinubu was a famous trader and leader who helped shape Nigerian history!

quizzes.question: Which Lagos park used to be a prison but is now a place for art and music?
quizzes.funFact: Freedom Park was turned from a colonial prison into a beautiful open space in 2010!

quizzes.question: Which ancient rock in Abeokuta was used as a fortress during wars?
quizzes.funFact: People once sheltered inside Olumo Rock's caves — you can still climb it today!
